results.title: Italianissimo 2: intermediate: a multimedia course for learning Italian
results.creator_credit: BBC Books and Denise De Rome
results.brief_description: The course book is divided into two levels, each of five units. Each unit contains conversations, key phrases, language patterns and a variety of exercises, including special vocabulary building sections. Each level is followed by grammar summaries, additional exercises and a “Cultura” section introducing some Italian paintings and poetry. The book accompanies the video and audio cassettes which may be borrowed as separate loan items.

results.title: Italianissimo 2: intermediate: a multimedia course for learning Italian
results.brief_description: This set of audio cassettes contain all the conversations from the course book as well as ten profile interviews recorded in Italy for the course. Learners are encouraged to take part in the conversational activities intended to develop their ability to understand and speak Italian. The cassettes are designed to be used with the course book, but can be used independently. The course book and videos may be borrowed as separate loan items.

results.title: Italianissimo 1: beginners: a multimedia course for learning italian
results.brief_description: The books contain most of the conversations recorded in the video episodes of the series. The “Teacher’s edition” gives detailed notes with additional material as well as lesson plans and optional exercises. The “Student’s edition” reviews material in the course with language exercises and notes on italian life and culture. The videos and audio-cassettes may be loaned as separate items. The author of the two texts is Denise De Rome.

results.title: Italianissimo 1: beginners: a BBC course for beginners in italian.
results.brief_description: Four cassettes which accompany the BBC language program on video. They contain conversations recorded for the television series, explanations and exercises, and additional authentic Italian. The student is encouraged to take part in conversational exercises designed to develop comprehension and vocabulary. The cassettes can be used in conjunction with the tapes and texts or by themselves. The videos and texts are available for loan as separate items.

results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Maria McCarthy and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.

results.title: Italian for beginners = Italiensk for begyndere
results.creator_credit: Ib Tardini, Danish Film Institute, Danish Radio-TV, Zentropa and Lone Scherfig
results.brief_description: Adhering to the Dogme 95 manifesto, signed by a group of like-minded Danish filmmakers committed to an independent film practice that wishes to see cinema become again an innovative, experimental and politically subversive art, “Italian for beginners” is the first comedy Dogme film to emerge. The narrative revolves around the fortunes of several Danes living near Copenhagen. These consist of: Andreas, a lonely new priest; Olympia, a clumsy pastry-shop assistant coping with an abusive and mentally unstable father; Karen, a hairdresser who has to fend off her alcoholic brain-damaged mother; Hal-Finn, a cafe manager with anger management issues; Jorgen, a loyal friend of Hal-Finn’s who forms a crush on Italian waitress, Guilia. These protagonists slowly overcome their woes and form meaningful relationships with each other, creating a mini-network of support, whilst also discovering several existing strains of interconnectedness. Written and directed by Lone Scherfig, “Italian for beginners” makes the most of its simple premise whilst gently probing the themes of family, relationships, love and romance, through a perspective that presages the absurdity of life. A thoroughly enjoyable lightweight addition to the rather grave Dogme canon. Cast includes Anders W. Berthelsen, Anette Stovelbaek, Ann Eleonora Jorgensen, Peter Gantzler, Lars Kaalund and Sara Indrio Jensen.

results.title: Italian farm family
results.brief_description: A glimpse of life in Italy during the late sixties in the farming area near Mt. Vesuvius. Shows the day to day life of the Falco family: the sowing and reaping of the crops, bread baking in the home and the many tasks undertaken by various members of the family. Also shown is the community life in the area.

results.title: Italian children
results.brief_description: Depicts activities in the daily life of farm children in the province of Umbria. Portrays features of their home environment such as their house, garden and food, show children participating in the farm work, particularly in the picking and processing of olives. Illustrates the role of family festivities and musical enjoyment in the lives of Italian children, and features market activities in the Italian city of Assissi.

results.title: Italian-Ethiopian war: Africa in world affairs
results.creator_credit: William Kronick, Alan Landsburg Productions, Films Incorporated and Anthony Potter
results.brief_description: Centres on the Italian Ethiopian war of 1935-1936 to lead into an examination of Italian fascism, the character of Mussolini, and how he came to power. Shows how the conflict was one of the chief episodes that paved the way for World War 2. Seen from an essentially American perspective, this film combines contemporaneous actuality footage and interviews with US academics. Written by Anthony Potter. This film is suitable for Upper Secondary levels.
